card.name: Abduction
card.ability:
Enchant creature
When Abduction enters the battlefield, untap enchanted creature.
You control enchanted creature.
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : Abduction may be cast targeting an untapped creature.

card.name: Abyssal Hunter
card.ability: {B}, {T}: Tap target creature. Abyssal Hunter deals damage equal to Abyssal Hunter's power to that creature.
card.flavor: Some smiles show cheer; some merely show teeth.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability can target an already tapped creature.

card.name: Abyssal Specter
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.

card.name: Adarkar Wastes
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool. Adarkar Wastes deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Æther Flash
card.ability: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, Æther Flash deals 2 damage to it.
card.flavor:
"You can't get there from here. Well, you can—it just won't be fun."
—Ertai, wizard adept
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This is not a targeted ability, so it deals damage to creatures that can't be targeted by spells and abilities.

card.name: Agonizing Memories
card.ability: Look at target player's hand and choose two cards from it. Put them on top of that player's library in any order.
card.flavor:
"An innocent man died because of my anger. That knowledge will haunt me for all eternity."
—Karn, silver golem

card.name: Air Elemental
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: As insubstantial, and as powerful, as the wind that carries it.

card.name: Aladdin's Ring
card.ability: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
". . . The magician drew a ring off his finger . . . , saying: ‘It is a talisman against all evil, so long as you obey me.'"
—The Arabian Nights,
Junior Classics trans.

card.name: Amber Prison
card.ability:
You may choose not to untap Amber Prison during your untap step.
{4}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land. That permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Amber Prison remains tapped.

card.name: Anaba Bodyguard
card.ability: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
card.flavor:
"Not all minotaurs are tribal. Some are freelance."
—Eron the Relentless

card.name: Anaba Shaman
card.ability: {R}, {T}: Anaba Shaman deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"The shamans? Ha They are craven cows not capable of true magic."
—Irini Sengir

card.name: Ancestral Memories
card.ability: Look at the top seven cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If there are less than 7 cards in the library, look at all of them. Put two into your hand, and the rest in the graveyard.
10/4/2004 : This is not considered a draw or a discard.

card.name: Animate Wall
card.ability:
Enchant Wall
Enchanted Wall can attack as though it didn't have defender.
card.flavor:
"When you have been bitten with fangs of granite, you start to long for the ivory sabers of tigers."
—Norin the Wary
card.ruling: 9/16/2007 : This is a change from the most recent wording. As was the case in the past, Animate Wall can now enchant only a Wall.

card.name: Ankh of Mishra
card.ability: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
card.flavor: Tawnos finally cracked the puzzle: the strange structures did not house Mishra's malevolent creations but were themselves among his creations.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This triggers on any land entering the battlefield. This includes playing a land or putting a land onto the battlefield using a spell or ability.
10/4/2004 : It determines the land's controller at the time the ability resolves. If the land leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the land's last controller before it left is used.

card.name: Archangel
card.ability: Flying, vigilance
card.flavor:
"My mother once told me angels sing their swords' names with each strike."
—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

card.name: Ardent Militia
card.ability: Vigilance
card.flavor: Some fight for honor and some for gold, but the militia fight for hearth and home.

card.name: Armageddon
card.ability: Destroy all lands.

card.name: Armored Pegasus
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Asked how it survived a run-in with a bog imp, the pegasus just shook its mane and burped.

card.name: Ashen Powder
card.ability: Put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
card.flavor:
"What you call decay, I call ripening. You'll gain no sustenance from this harvest."
—Kaervek

card.name: Ashnod's Altar
card.ability: Sacrifice a creature: Add {2} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: The Brothers' War scarred the land, but Ashnod left her mark in the bloodlines of those she tortured.

card.name: Balduvian Barbarians
card.flavor:
"Barbarian raids were a concern to those living in the northwest provinces, but the skyknights never dealt with the problem in a systematic way. They thought of the Balduvians as an ‘amusing model' of their forebears' culture."
—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization

card.name: Balduvian Horde
card.ability: When Balduvian Horde enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You choose whether to discard or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice this card. You can choose to not discard even if you no longer control this card on resolution.

card.name: Birds of Paradise
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Blaze
card.ability: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Fire never dies alone.

card.name: Blight
card.ability:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.

card.name: Blighted Shaman
card.ability:
{T}, Sacrifice a Swamp: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{T}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

card.name: Blood Pet
card.ability: Sacrifice Blood Pet: Add {B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "You are wrong," Volrath said. "I do not hate the living. They often prove quite useful to me." And then he laughed.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : Because combat damage resolves immediately after it is assigned, you cannot sacrifice Blood Pet in between assigning and dealing combat damage. The last chance you have to sacrifice it before combat damage is dealt is during the Declare Blockers step.

card.name: Bog Imp
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: Don't be fooled by their looks. Think of them as little knives with wings.

card.name: Bog Rats
card.ability: Bog Rats can't be blocked by Walls.
card.flavor: Their stench was vile and strong enough, but not nearly as powerful as their hunger.

card.name: Bog Wraith
card.ability: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
card.flavor: It moved through the troops leaving no footprints, save on their souls.

card.name: Boil
card.ability: Destroy all Islands.
card.flavor:
"The fishers will throw out their nets and draw them back filled with dust."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Boomerang
card.ability: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: A lie always returns; be careful how you catch it.

card.name: Bottle of Suleiman
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice Bottle of Suleiman: Flip a coin. If you lose the flip, Bottle of Suleiman deals 5 damage to you. If you win the flip, put a 5/5 colorless Djinn artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The coin is flipped on resolution and not on declaration of the ability.

card.name: Browse
card.ability: {2}{U}{U}: Look at the top five cards of your library, put one of them into your hand, and exile the rest.
card.flavor:
"Once great literature—now great litter."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

card.name: Brushland
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool. Brushland deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Burrowing
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has mountainwalk.

card.name: Call of the Wild
card.ability: {2}{G}{G}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.
card.flavor: Thinking of dinner made Squee realize that the forest was probably thinking the same thing.

card.name: Castle
card.ability: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2.
card.flavor:
"Hang out our banners on the outward walls; / The cry is still, ‘They come'; our castle's strength / Will laugh a siege to scorn."
—William Shakespeare, Macbeth

card.name: Cat Warriors
card.ability: Forestwalk
card.flavor: These stealthy felines have survived so many battles that some believe they must possess many lives.

card.name: Celestial Dawn
card.ability:
Lands you control are Plains.
Nonland cards you own that aren't on the battlefield, spells you control, and nonland permanents you control are white.
You may spend white mana as though it were mana of any color. You may spend other mana only as though it were colorless mana.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The effect to turn all your non-land cards (including artifacts) white is the effect of a static ability. Thus, a color change on a permanent prior to Celestial Dawn entering the battlefield will be overridden by Celestial Dawn's effect.
10/4/2004 : Celestial Dawn does not change the type of lands which are not on the battlefield. Lands not on the battlefield are what they say they are.
10/4/2004 : Will not add or remove Snow Supertype from a land.
10/4/2004 : You may use a different color mana than the color required for spells and abilities that require a specific color. If you do, and the spell or ability checks the actual color of the mana, it can tell the difference.
10/4/2004 : If you pay white mana to activate an ability that can only be activated by spending another color of mana, then any limitations on activating the ability (such as the number of times it can be activated each turn) still apply as if you spent the proper color.
10/4/2004 : Celestial Dawn no longer changes mana symbols on cards.
9/25/2006 : Mana produced by spells you control and nonland permanents you control isn't affected by Celestial Dawn. Llanowar Elves will produce {G}, for example. However, any colored mana may be spent only on the colorless part of costs.
9/25/2006 : Land cards you own that aren't on the battlefield aren't changed to Plains.
9/25/2006 : If you have nonwhite mana in your mana pool when Celestial Dawn enters the battlefield, it remains there but you can spend it only on the colorless part of costs.
9/25/2006 : "Enters the battlefield" triggered abilities of lands you play won't trigger since the lands will enter the battlefield as Plains. Effects that modify how those lands enter the battlefield, however, will still work. For example, if you play a Dimir Aqueduct, it will enter the battlefield tapped as a Plains, but you won't return a land to your hand.
9/25/2006 : If you use a text-changing effect such as Mind Bend on Celestial Dawn to change the word "Plains" to a different land type, your lands are all of that new land type, and they will produce mana of the appropriate color for that type.
9/25/2006 : If a permanent enters the battlefield while Celestial Dawn is on the battlefield, and then Celestial Dawn leaves the battlefield, the permanent's color will revert to the colors in its mana cost.

card.name: Charcoal Diamond
card.ability:
Charcoal Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

card.name: Chill
card.ability: Red spells cost {2} more to cast.
card.flavor:
"Temper, temper."
—Ertai, wizard adept

card.name: Circle of Protection: Black
card.ability: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Blue
card.ability: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Green
card.ability: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Red
card.ability: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: White
card.ability: {1}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: City of Brass
card.ability:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The damaging ability triggers no matter how the land becomes tapped.

card.name: Coercion
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
card.flavor:
A rhino's bargain
—Femeref expression meaning
"a situation with no choices"

card.name: Conquer
card.ability:
Enchant land
You control enchanted land.
card.flavor:
"Why do we trade with those despicable elves? You don't live in forests, you burn them"
—Avram Garrisson,
Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

card.name: Counterspell
card.ability: Counter target spell.

card.name: Creeping Mold
card.ability: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
card.flavor:
"Mold could catch you."
—Suq'Ata insult

card.name: Crimson Hellkite
card.ability:
Flying
{X}, {T}: Crimson Hellkite deals X damage to target creature. Spend only red mana this way.
card.flavor:
"Dragonfire forged me a warrior."
—Rashida Scalebane

card.name: Crusade
card.ability: White creatures get +1/+1.

card.name: Crystal Rod
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

card.name: Crystal Vein
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Crystal Vein: Add {2} to your mana pool.

card.name: Cursed Totem
card.ability: Activated abilities of creatures can't be activated.
card.flavor:
Pass me from soul to soul, / soldier to herder, herder to beast, beast to soil / until I am everywhere. / Then pass me those souls.
—Totem inscription (translated)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Cursed Totem does not prevent creature cards which are not on the battlefield from having their abilities activated.
10/4/2004 : Cursed Totem can prevent mana abilities from being activated.

card.name: Dancing Scimitar
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: Bobbing merrily from opponent to opponent, the scimitar began adding playful little flourishes to its strokes; it even turned a couple of somersaults.

card.name: Daraja Griffin
card.ability:
Flying
Sacrifice Daraja Griffin: Destroy target black creature.
card.flavor:
"And the flamingos said, ‘Get out of our nest—we can't be seen with the likes of you' So, the griffin ate them."
—Azeworai, "The Ugly Bird"

card.name: Daring Apprentice
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Daring Apprentice: Counter target spell.
card.flavor: In front of every great wizard is a doomed apprentice.

card.name: D'Avenant Archer
card.ability: {T}: D'Avenant Archer deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
card.flavor: Avenant's archers are also trained as poets, so that each arrow is guided by a fragment of verse.

card.name: Deflection
card.ability: Change the target of target spell with a single target.
card.flavor:
Up and down,
over and through,
back around—
the joke's on you.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Once the spell resolves, the new target is considered to be targeted by the deflected spell. This will trigger any effects which trigger on being targeted.
10/4/2004 : This only targets the spell being changed, not the original or new target of the spell it is affecting.
10/4/2004 : The target of a spell that targets another spell on the stack can be changed to any other spell on the stack, even if the new target will resolve before the spell does.
10/4/2004 : You can't make a spell which is on the stack target itself.
10/4/2004 : You can choose to make a spell on the stack target this spell (if such a target choice would be legal had the spell been cast while this spell was on the stack). The new target for the deflected spell is not chosen until this spell resolves. This spell is still on the stack when new targets are selected for the spell.
10/4/2004 : If there is no other legal target for the spell, this does not change the target.
10/4/2004 : This does not check if the current target is legal. It just checks if the spell has a single target.
10/4/2004 : You choose the spell to target on announcement, but you pick the new target for that spell on resolution.
2/1/2009 : If a spell targets multiple things, you can't target it with Deflection, even if all but one of those targets has become illegal.
2/1/2009 : If a spell targets the same player or object multiple times, you can't target it with Deflection.

card.name: Dense Foliage
card.ability: Creatures can't be the targets of spells.
card.flavor:
"Big plants not only good for hidin', but full o' tasty bugs, too."
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

card.name: Derelor
card.ability: Black spells you cast cost {B} more to cast.
card.flavor:
"Strength it has, but at the cost of a continuous supply of energy. Such failure can bear only one result."
—Execution order of Endrek Sahr,
master breeder

card.name: Desertion
card.ability: Counter target spell. If an artifact or creature spell is countered this way, put that card onto the battlefield under your control instead of into its owner's graveyard.
card.flavor: First the insult, then the injury.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The card is put onto the battlefield, but any effects that check if the original card was "cast from your hand" will not trigger or otherwise consider the card to have been cast from your hand. The card was put onto the battlefield by the effect of Desertion instead.
10/4/2004 : This spell includes a replacement effect. If the target is an artifact or creature, it never goes to the graveyard.
10/4/2004 : If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then this card's ability does not put the card onto the battlefield. The spell continues to resolve as normal.

card.name: Diminishing Returns
card.ability: Each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library. You exile the top ten cards of your library. Then each player draws up to seven cards.
card.ruling:
9/16/2007 : Each player may choose to draw any number of cards from zero to seven.
9/16/2007 : First the player whose turn it is chooses how many cards to draw, then each other player in turn order chooses. Then the cards are drawn, first by the player whose turn it is, then by each other player in turn order.

card.name: Dingus Egg
card.ability: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

card.name: Disenchant
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

card.name: Disrupting Scepter
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can use it on yourself.

card.name: Divine Transformation
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
card.flavor: Glory surged through her and radiance surrounded her. All things were possible with the blessing of the Divine.

card.name: Doomsday
card.ability: Search your library and graveyard for five cards and exile the rest. Put the chosen cards on top of your library in any order. You lose half your life, rounded up.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You lose the life during resolution.
4/1/2008 : If your graveyard and library combined contain five or more cards, you must choose five cards from among them. You can’t choose to find fewer than that.
4/1/2008 : If your graveyard and library combined contain fewer than five cards, all of those cards will wind up in your library.

card.name: Dragon Engine
card.ability: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"How is it the legged engines seem so much more alive than their wheeled counterparts? Simply, they were born, not made."
—Mishra

card.name: Dragon Mask
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Return it to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
card.flavor:
"With no further options, I was forced to don the mask."
—Rashida Scalebane

card.name: Dread of Night
card.ability: White creatures get -1/-1.
card.flavor:
"These moonless, foreign skies keep me in thrall. Dark whispers echo in the night, and I cannot resist."
—Selenia, dark angel

card.name: Dream Cache
card.ability: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand both on top of your library or both on the bottom of your library.
card.flavor:
Dreams' riches are easily spent.
—Suq'Ata adage

card.name: Drudge Skeletons
card.ability: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
card.flavor:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, they never surrender, and they don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral, Necromancer's Handbook

card.name: Dry Spell
card.ability: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
card.flavor:
"Wherever water is lacking, all things suffer."
—Autumn Willow

card.name: Dwarven Ruins
card.ability:
Dwarven Ruins enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Dwarven Ruins: Add {R}{R} to your mana pool.

card.name: Early Harvest
card.ability: Target player untaps all basic lands he or she controls.
card.flavor:
"Tonight we'll have a farewell feast. Cold corn porridge is not enough. / Let's peel papayas, pineapples, and mangoes, drink coconut milk, / and bake bananas."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

card.name: Earthquake
card.ability: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Whether or not a creature is without flying is only checked on resolution.

card.name: Ebon Stronghold
card.ability:
Ebon Stronghold enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Ebon Stronghold: Add {B}{B} to your mana pool.

card.name: Ekundu Griffin
card.ability: Flying, first strike
card.flavor:
"My goat was a small price to pay for the chance to see the hunting griffin dive and seize it."
—Suq'Ata trader

card.name: Elder Druid
card.ability: {3}{G}, {T}: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
card.flavor:
"Did clouds dance in his eyes,
did thorns play at his fingertips?"
—Shesul Fass, faerie bard
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The decision of whether to tap or untap is made on resolution.

card.name: Elven Cache
card.ability: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Elves know where to harvest the best of the forest, for they planted it there themselves.

card.name: Elven Riders
card.ability: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.
card.flavor:
Sometimes it is better to be swift of foot than strong of swordarm.
—Elven proverb
card.ruling: 5/1/2007 : Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don’t actually have Flying, so they can’t block this.

card.name: Elvish Archers
card.ability: First strike
card.flavor: "I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, ‘Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade'"

card.name: Enfeeblement
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.
card.flavor:
"If it is weak, either kill it or ignore it. Anything else honors it."
—Kaervek

card.name: Enlightened Tutor
card.ability: Search your library for an artifact or enchantment card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
card.flavor:
"I do not teach. I simply reveal."
—Daudi, Femeref tutor
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The "shuffle and put the card on top" is a single action. If an effect is making the top card of the library face up, the second card down on the library is not revealed.
10/4/2004 : You do not have to find an artifact or enchantment card if you do not want to.

card.name: Ethereal Champion
card.ability: Pay 1 life: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Ethereal Champion this turn.
card.flavor:
"If I have learned anything as a wizard it is this: never fight your own battles."
—Waffa, sorcerer of Nyomba

card.name: Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore
card.ability:
Non-Eye creatures you control can't attack.
Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore can't be blocked except by Walls.
card.flavor: The highway of fear is the shortest route to defeat.

card.name: Exile
card.ability: Exile target nonwhite attacking creature. You gain life equal to its toughness.

card.name: Fallen Angel
card.ability:
Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Fallen Angel gets +2/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Angels are simply extensions of truth upon the fabric of life—and there is far more dark than light."Baron Sengir
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can sacrifice itself.

card.name: Fallow Earth
card.ability: Put target land on top of its owner's library.
card.flavor:
". . . and when the farmer awoke the next morning, all the seeds from his field were once again in their sacks."
—Afari, Tales

card.name: Familiar Ground
card.ability: Each creature you control can't be blocked by more than one creature.
card.flavor:
"I'd rather fight on foreign soil. That way, if I lose I can blame it on the terrain."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : When combined with an effect that reads "Each creature you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures," none of your creatures can be blocked.

card.name: Fatal Blow
card.ability: Destroy target creature that was dealt damage this turn. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"What is crueler? To let a wound of the heart fester, or to simply cut it out?"
—Crovax
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : Fatal Blow can’t target a creature that hasn’t been dealt damage this turn.
4/1/2008 : Fatal Blow cares whether the creature had been dealt damage during the turn, not whether there is still damage on it. If the creature had regenerated, causing all damage to clear, Fatal Blow can still target and destroy it.

card.name: Fear
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

card.name: Feast of the Unicorn
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +4/+0.
card.flavor:
"Could there be a fouler act? No doubt the baron knows of one."
—Autumn Willow

card.name: Femeref Archers
card.ability: {T}: Femeref Archers deals 4 damage to target attacking creature with flying.
card.flavor:
"They say a Zhalfirin archer can split the eye of a griffin. Nonsense, of course; they have no faith to guide their darts."
—Nuru, Femeref archer

card.name: Feral Shadow
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Not all shadows are cast by light—some are cast by darkness.

card.name: Fervor
card.ability: Creatures you control have haste. (They can attack and {T} as soon as they come under your control.)
card.flavor:
"If your blood doesn't run hot, I will make it run in the sands"
—Maraxus of Keld
card.ruling: 7/1/2012 : If an attacking creature loses haste, perhaps because Fervor leaves the battlefield after attackers have been declared, it won't be removed from combat.

card.name: Final Fortune
card.ability: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.
card.flavor:
Want all, lose all.
—Zhalfirin aphorism
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you end up skipping the extra turn that is gained, you do not lose the game.
10/4/2004 : If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

card.name: Fire Diamond
card.ability:
Fire Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

card.name: Fire Elemental
card.flavor: Fire elementals are ruthless infernos, annihilating and consuming their foes in a frenzied holocaust. Crackling and blazing, they sear swift, terrible paths, leaving the land charred and scorched in their wake.

card.name: Firebreathing
card.ability:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Magic's only part of it, my friend. Diet does the rest."
—Suq'Ata trader
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : This ability can be activated by Firebreathing's controller, not the enchanted creature's controller (in case they're different players).
10/1/2009 : The ability affects whichever creature is enchanted by Firebreathing at the time the ability resolves. The bonus remains even if Firebreathing stops enchanting that creature.

card.name: Fit of Rage
card.ability: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Anger is fleeting; remorse is eternal."
—Karn, silver golem
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The +3/+3 is also only until end of turn.

card.name: Flame Spirit
card.ability: {R}: Flame Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The spirit of the flame is the spirit of change."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian chieftain

card.name: Flash
card.ability: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. If you do, sacrifice it unless you pay its mana cost reduced by up to {2}.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Any X in the creature's mana cost is zero.
10/4/2004 : The mana cost you pay includes colored mana.
5/1/2007 : The creature enters the battlefield, so it will trigger enters-the-battlefield abilities even if you have chosen to not pay.
10/1/2009 : If you choose not to pay, the creature is sacrificed immediately. No player will get priority in between the creature entering the battlefield and being sacrificed. Sacrificing the creature this way will trigger any abilities that trigger when a creature leaves the battlefield.

card.name: Flashfires
card.ability: Destroy all Plains.

card.name: Flight
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.

card.name: Flying Carpet
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

card.name: Fog
card.ability: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : Fog has no effect on damage that's already been dealt.

card.name: Fog Elemental
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Fog Elemental attacks or blocks, sacrifice it at end of combat.
card.flavor:
"I've seen fog so thick you could cut it, but none that could cut me."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

card.name: Forbidden Crypt
card.ability:
If you would draw a card, return a card from your graveyard to your hand instead. If you can't, you lose the game.
If a card would be put into your graveyard from anywhere, exile that card instead.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It will replace itself being sent to the graveyard, and exile itself.
10/4/2004 : The second ability is a replacement effect, not a triggered ability. The card never gets to the graveyard.
10/4/2004 : The "if you can't" in the first ability refers to putting the card in your hand, as well as being unable to choose a card. Thus, if you can't choose a card during resolution, you lose the game.
10/4/2004 : If more than one card is being drawn due to a single effect, apply the replacement as if the cards were being drawn one at a time.

card.name: Forget
card.ability: Target player discards two cards, then draws as many cards as he or she discarded this way.

card.name: Fountain of Youth
card.ability: {2}, {T}: You gain 1 life.
card.flavor: The fountain had stood in the town square for centuries, but only the pigeons knew its secret.

card.name: Fyndhorn Brownie
card.ability: {2}{G}, {T}: Untap target creature.
card.flavor:
"I've been insulted by drunks in a hundred inns, but never as skillfully or annoyingly as by those blasted brownies."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

card.name: Fyndhorn Elder
card.ability: {T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"Do we know what we're doing? Yes—the will of Freyalise."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

card.name: Gaseous Form
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.

card.name: Giant Growth
card.ability: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

card.name: Giant Spider
card.ability: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: It's not far into the trap, as the crow flies.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

card.name: Giant Strength
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
card.flavor:
"O it is excellent / To have a giant's strength, but it is tyrannous / To use it like a giant."
—William Shakespeare,
Measure for Measure

card.name: Glacial Wall
card.ability: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
card.flavor:
"Huge walls of ice block further travel. We can't believe they are natural."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

card.name: Glasses of Urza
card.ability: {T}: Look at target player's hand.

card.name: Goblin Digging Team
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.
card.flavor:
"From down here we can make the whole wall collapse"
"Uh, yeah, boss, but how do we get out?"

card.name: Goblin Elite Infantry
card.ability: Whenever Goblin Elite Infantry blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: They talk a good fight.

card.name: Goblin Hero
card.flavor:
"When you're a goblin, you don't have to step forward to be a hero—everyone else just has to step back"
—Biggum Flodrot, goblin veteran

card.name: Goblin King
card.ability: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
card.flavor: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok . . . ."
card.ruling: 8/1/2005 : Goblin King now has the Goblin creature type and its ability has been reworded to affect *other* Goblins. This means that if two Goblin Kings are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

card.name: Goblin Recruiter
card.ability: When Goblin Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for any number of Goblin cards and reveal those cards. Shuffle your library, then put them on top of it in any order.
card.flavor: "Next"
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type "Summon Goblin" and "Summon Goblins" also count. You can't search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don't have the creature type Goblin.

card.name: Goblin Warrens
card.ability: {2}{R}, Sacrifice two Goblins: Put three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: "Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late."Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The token Goblins can be sacrificed to the Warrens to generate new Goblins.

card.name: Gorilla Chieftain
card.ability: {1}{G}: Regenerate Gorilla Chieftain.
card.flavor:
"In the soil of leadership sprout the seeds of immortality."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper

card.name: Gravebane Zombie
card.ability: If Gravebane Zombie would die, put Gravebane Zombie on top of its owner's library instead.

card.name: Gravedigger
card.ability: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Greed
card.ability: {B}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"There is no calamity greater than lavish desires. There is no greater guilt than discontentment. And there is no greater disaster than greed."
—Lao Tsu, Tao Te Ching, (trans. Chan)

card.name: Grinning Totem
card.ability: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Grinning Totem: Search target opponent's library for a card and exile it. Then that player shuffles his or her library. Until the beginning of your next upkeep, you may play that card. At the beginning of your next upkeep, if you haven't played it, put it into its owner's graveyard.
card.ruling:
9/25/2006 : You may choose to find any kind of card, including a land. You must exile a card (unless the opponent's library is empty); you can't fail to find anything.
9/25/2006 : "Until the beginning of your next upkeep" means the effect wears off as soon as your next upkeep starts. Your last chance to play the card is usually the End step of the player who immediately precedes you.
9/25/2006 : The exiled card is played using the normal rules for timing and priority for its card type, as well as any other applicable restrictions. You'll have to pay its mana cost. The only thing that's different is you're casting it from the Exile zone.

card.name: Grizzly Bears
card.flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominaria's grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

card.name: Hammer of Bogardan
card.ability:
Hammer of Bogardan deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
{2}{R}{R}{R}: Return Hammer of Bogardan from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

card.name: Harmattan Efreet
card.ability:
Flying
{1}{U}{U}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"One moment I was walking along the beach, and the next I was high in the air, staring into a hideous smiling face."
—Tarub, Suq'Ata sailor

card.name: Havenwood Battleground
card.ability:
Havenwood Battleground enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Havenwood Battleground: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.

card.name: Healing Salve
card.ability: Choose one — Target player gains 3 life; or prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

card.name: Heavy Ballista
card.ability: {T}: Heavy Ballista deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
card.flavor:
"Archers, balliste—you can't even get near the island of Avenant."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

card.name: Hecatomb
card.ability:
When Hecatomb enters the battlefield, sacrifice Hecatomb unless you sacrifice four creatures.
Tap an untapped Swamp you control: Hecatomb deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you have less than 4 creatures, you do not partially sacrifice. You pay 4 creatures or none.
10/4/2004 : The sacrifice is done as a triggered ability just after it enters the battlefield. It is not done on casting.
10/4/2004 : You choose whether to sacrifice creatures or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice Hecatomb. You can choose to not sacrifice creatures if you no longer control this card on resolution.

card.name: Hero's Resolve
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+5.
card.flavor:
"Destiny, chance, fate, fortune—they're all just ways of claiming your successes without claiming your failures."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

card.name: Hidden Horror
card.ability: When Hidden Horror enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a creature card.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : When the ability resolves, you choose whether to sacrifice the creature or perform the other action. If you can’t perform the other action, then you must sacrifice the creature.
4/1/2008 : If the creature is no longer on the battlefield when the ability resolves, you may still perform the action if you want.

card.name: Horned Turtle
card.flavor:
"So like men are they: a hardened shell with fragile flesh beneath."
—Selenia, dark angel

card.name: Howl from Beyond
card.ability: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Howling Mine
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If Howling Mine leaves the battlefield before it resolves, then the last known tap or untap state of the card is used for resolution.
10/4/2004 : It does not trigger at all if this is tapped at the start of the draw step, and it checks this again on resolution.
10/4/2004 : The additional draw is separate from any other draw during your draw step. It happens when the triggered ability resolves.
4/15/2013 : The triggered ability is put onto the stack after you have already drawn your card for the turn.

card.name: Hulking Cyclops
card.ability: Hulking Cyclops can't block.
card.flavor: Anyone can get around a cyclops, but few can stand in its way.

card.name: Hurricane
card.ability: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

card.name: Icatian Town
card.ability: Put four 1/1 white Citizen creature tokens onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: Icatia's once-peaceful towns faced increasing attacks from orcs and goblins as the climate cooled. By the time the empire fell, they were little more than armed camps.

card.name: Illicit Auction
card.ability: Each player may bid life for control of target creature. You start the bidding with a bid of 0. In turn order, each player may top the high bid. The bidding ends if the high bid stands. The high bidder loses life equal to the high bid and gains control of the creature. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This is a life loss and not a life payment so you can bid more life than you have.

card.name: Infantry Veteran
card.ability: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The true dishonor for a soldier is surviving the war."
—Telim'Tor
card.ruling: 8/15/2010 : An "attacking creature" is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.

card.name: Infernal Contract
card.ability: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up.
card.flavor:
"But I signed nothing"
—Taraneh, Suq'Ata mage
card.ruling: 2/1/2007 : If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0.  This means that the life total stays the same.  A life total of -10 would remain -10.

card.name: Inferno
card.ability: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
card.flavor: "Some have said there is no subtlety to destruction. You know what? They're dead."Jaya Ballard, task mage

card.name: Insight
card.ability: Whenever an opponent casts a green spell, you draw a card.
card.flavor:
"We can fight with you or against you. After my day, I'd prefer the former."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

card.name: Inspiration
card.ability: Target player draws two cards.
card.flavor:
"Madness and genius are separated only by degrees of success."
—Sidar Jabari

card.name: Iron Star
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

card.name: Ivory Cup
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

card.name: Jade Monolith
card.ability: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.

card.name: Jalum Tome
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
card.flavor: This timeworn relic was responsible for many of Urza's victories, though he never fully comprehended its mystic runes.

card.name: Jayemdae Tome
card.ability: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.

card.name: Jokulhaups
card.ability: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and lands. They can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"The raging waters had swept away trees, bridges, and even houses. My healers had much work to do."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

card.name: Juxtapose
card.ability: You and target player exchange control of the creature you each control with the highest converted mana cost. Then exchange control of artifacts the same way. If two or more permanents a player controls are tied for highest cost, their controller chooses one of them.
card.ruling:
9/16/2007 : First creatures are exchanged, then artifacts are exchanged. It's possible that the same artifact creature may be involved in both exchanges.
9/16/2007 : No permanents are targeted by this effect, so permanents with Shroud may be exchanged this way.
9/16/2007 : If one of the players doesn't control a creature at the time the exchange would be made, that part of the effect does nothing, but the exchange of artifacts will still happen. Similarly, if one of the players doesn't control an artifact at the time the exchange would be made, that part of the effect does nothing.

card.name: Karplusan Forest
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool. Karplusan Forest deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Kismet
card.ability: Artifacts, creatures, and lands played by your opponents enter the battlefield tapped.
card.flavor:
"Make people wait for what they want, and you have power over them. This is as true for merchants and militia as it is for cooks and couples."
—Gwendlyn Di Corci
card.ruling:
2/1/2007 : Cards enter the battlefield tapped. They do not enter the battlefield untapped and then immediately tap, therefore they do not trigger any effects due to tapping.
2/1/2007 : It affects all opponents.
2/1/2007 : Does not affect cards that phase in.

card.name: Kjeldoran Dead
card.ability:
When Kjeldoran Dead enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
{B}: Regenerate Kjeldoran Dead.
card.flavor:
"They shall drink sorrow's dregs. They shall kill those whom once they loved."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The sacrifice is a triggered ability and not a cost.
10/1/2008 : When Kjeldoran Dead's enters-the-battlefield ability resolves, if you don't control any other creatures, you must sacrifice Kjeldoran Dead itself.

card.name: Kjeldoran Royal Guard
card.ability: {T}: All combat damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures this turn is dealt to Kjeldoran Royal Guard instead.
card.flavor:
Honorable in battle, generous in death.
—Motto of the Kjeldoran Royal Guard
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If you activate the ability but Kjeldoran Royal Guard leaves the battlefield before combat damage is dealt, the combat damage from unblocked creatures won't be redirected. It will be dealt to you as normal.

card.name: Lead Golem
card.ability: Whenever Lead Golem attacks, it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
card.flavor: Slow and heavy swings the club.

card.name: Leshrac's Rite
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has swampwalk.
card.flavor:
"Bind me to thee, my soul to thine. I am your servant and your slave. Blood for blood, flesh for flesh, Leshrac, my lord."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

card.name: Library of Lat-Nam
card.ability: An opponent chooses one — You draw three cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep; or you search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle your library.

card.name: Light of Day
card.ability: Black creatures can't attack or block.
card.flavor:
"I do not miss sunlight. The very memory of it burns my eyes."
—Volrath

card.name: Lightning Blast
card.ability: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"Those who fear the darkness have never seen what the light can do."
—Selenia, dark angel

card.name: Living Lands
card.ability: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Llanowar Elves
card.ability: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing

card.name: Longbow Archer
card.ability: First strike; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor:
"If it bears wings, I will pin it to the skies over Tefemburu."
—Roya, Zhalfirin archer
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

card.name: Lord of Atlantis
card.ability: Other Merfolk creatures get +1/+1 and have islandwalk.
card.flavor: A master of tactics, the lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.

card.name: Lost Soul
card.ability: Swampwalk
card.flavor: Her hand gently beckons, she whispers your name—but those who go with her are never the same.

card.name: Lure
card.ability:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
card.flavor: When setting a snare, success depends not on the quality of the trap, but the quality of the bait.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Lure does not give a creature the ability to block the Lured creature, it just forces those creatures which are already able to block the Lured creature to do so.
10/4/2004 : If a Lured creature is in a band, only blockers able to block the Lured creature are affected by the Lure.
10/4/2004 : The opponent does not have to activate any abilities in an attempt to make his or her creatures block. More specifically, a cost to block of zero mana is an optional cost you can choose not to pay.

card.name: Mana Prism
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Mana Short
card.ability: Tap all lands target player controls and empty his or her mana pool.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Since this is an Instant, your opponent may use Instants in response to the casting of this spell. Note that such spells and abilities will be resolved before the mana pool is emptied by the Mana Short. This makes it useless as a countermeasure for spells. To use it effectively, you need to use it during Upkeep and even then it will not prevent the use of Instant spells and abilities.
10/4/2004 : If you play Mana Short in response to a spell, it will have no effect on that spell since the mana has already been paid.
10/4/2004 : It even taps lands that do not produce mana.

card.name: Manabarbs
card.ability: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This card has a triggered ability that causes a separate effect for 1 point of damage each time a land is tapped for mana.
10/1/2009 : This ability is not a mana ability. It goes on the stack and can be responded to.
10/1/2009 : The ability will trigger each time a land is tapped for mana. Each ability is separate.
10/1/2009 : If any lands are tapped for mana while a player is casting a spell or activating an ability, Manabarbs's ability will trigger that many times and wait. When the player finishes casting that spell or activating that ability, it's put on the stack, then Manabarbs's triggered abilities are put on the stack on top of it. The Manabarbs abilities will resolve first.
10/1/2009 : On the other hand, a player can tap lands for mana, let the Manabarbs triggered abilities be put on the stack, and then respond to those abilities by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the spell or ability will resolve first.

card.name: Marble Diamond
card.ability:
Marble Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

card.name: Maro
card.ability: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
card.flavor: No two see the same Maro.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Creatures are only put into a graveyard for having 0 toughness when state-based actions are checked. If Maro's toughness goes to 0 during the announcement or resolution of a spell or ability and then goes back up above 0 before the end of that announcement or resolution, it won't be put into your graveyard when state-based actions are checked.

card.name: Meekstone
card.ability: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
card.flavor: When the mighty sleep, the lowly prowl.

card.name: Memory Lapse
card.ability: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.
card.flavor:
"Um . . . oh . . . what was I saying?"
—Reveka, wizard savant
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The card does not go to the graveyard before being put on the library.
10/4/2004 : This card has a self replacement. This means that it replaces going to the graveyard before any other effect can replace that event. If Flashback is applied, however, Flashback will change the destination.
10/4/2004 : If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then it does not go to its owner's library.

card.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
card.flavor: Are merfolk humans with fins, or are humans merfolk with feet?

card.name: Mesa Falcon
card.ability:
Flying
{1}{W}: Mesa Falcon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The faith of Serra is borne on wings of hope."
—Gulsen, abbey matron

card.name: Millstone
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: More than one mage has been driven insane by the sound of the millstone relentlessly grinding away.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Can be used on a player with less than 2 cards in their library. It will remove 0 or 1 cards if that is all that is available.
10/4/2004 : It is not a draw effect so it will not cause a player with less than 2 cards in their library to lose.
10/4/2004 : Since you are putting more than one card in the graveyard at one time, the affected player can choose the order the 2 cards go in.

card.name: Mind Warp
card.ability: Look at target player's hand and choose X cards from it. That player discards those cards.
card.flavor: The hardest of wizards can have the softest of minds.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The target player decides what order to put the cards in the graveyard. You decide which cards, but they do the discarding.

card.name: Mischievous Poltergeist
card.ability:
Flying
Pay 1 life: Regenerate Mischievous Poltergeist.
card.flavor:
"The past is a ghost that haunts you from the moment it exists until the moment you don't."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

card.name: Moss Diamond
card.ability:
Moss Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

card.name: Mountain Goat
card.ability: Mountainwalk
card.flavor: Only the heroic and the mad follow mountain goat trails.

card.name: Mystic Compass
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

card.name: Mystical Tutor
card.ability: Search your library for an instant or sorcery card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
card.flavor:
"To the tutors, a ‘poem of sand' was of little account, a ‘poem of ivory,' priceless."
—Afari, Tales
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You do not have to find an Instant or Sorcery card if you do not want to.

card.name: Nature's Resurgence
card.ability: Each player draws a card for each creature card in his or her graveyard.
card.flavor:
Spring follows winter
—Elvish expression meaning
"all things pass"

card.name: Necrosavant
card.ability: {3}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return Necrosavant from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability is activated while this card is in the graveyard.

card.name: Nightmare
card.ability:
Flying
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
card.flavor: As the poisoned land spreads, so does the nightmare's rage and terrifying strength.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority.
10/1/2009 : Nightmare's power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes.

card.name: Obsianus Golem
card.flavor:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone . . . ."
—"Song of the Artificer"

card.name: Orcish Artillery
card.ability: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
card.flavor: In a rare display of ingenuity, the orcs invented an incredibly destructive weapon. Most orcish artillerists are those who dared criticize its effectiveness.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You do not take the 3 points of damage if the ability is countered because the target is illegal.

card.name: Orcish Oriflamme
card.ability: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

card.name: Order of the Sacred Torch
card.ability: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target black spell.
card.flavor: A blazing light to drive out the shadows.

card.name: Ornithopter
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor:
"It has been my honor to improve on the Thran's original design. Perhaps history will remember me in some small part for my work."
—Urza, in his apprenticeship

card.name: Pacifism
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
card.flavor: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.

card.name: Painful Memories
card.ability: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card from it. Put that card on top of that player's library.
card.flavor:
"It is terrible how one brief action can live forever in memory."
—Jolrael

card.name: Panther Warriors
card.flavor: The dogs of war are nothing compared to the cats.

card.name: Patagia Golem
card.ability: {3}: Patagia Golem gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: It scattered falcons like a lion hunting among jackals.

card.name: Pearl Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
{1}{W}: Pearl Dragon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"They knew Bantau was lost when, to hide the pearl he had found on the beach, he swallowed it—and soon grew wings."
—Hakim, Loreweaver

card.name: Pentagram of the Ages
card.ability: {4}, {T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.flavor: A mirror, a shield, a promise, a great distance, and a kind word—five ways to avoid harm.

card.name: Perish
card.ability: Destroy all green creatures. They can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"There will come a time when the voices of soil and seedling will sing only laments."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Pestilence
card.ability:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence.
{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Each activation is considered a new damage effect. An activation can only be 1 point of damage.
6/1/2011 : Note that "until end of turn" effects wear off after "at the beginning of the end step" triggered abilities, so an artifact that animates until end of turn can keep this on the battlefield.
6/1/2011 : It will stay on the battlefield if there is a creature that is put into the graveyard during the end step. This is because this ability will not trigger at all if there is at least one creature on the battlefield as the end step begins.

card.name: Phantasmal Terrain
card.ability:
Enchant land
As Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.
card.ruling: 10/15/2006 : Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

card.name: Phantom Warrior
card.ability: Phantom Warrior is unblockable.
card.flavor: The phantom warrior comes from nowhere and returns there just as quickly.

card.name: Phyrexian Vault
card.ability: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"The secrets of Phyrexia are expensive. You will pay in brass and bone, steel and sinew."
—Kaervek

card.name: Pillage
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.

card.name: Polymorph
card.ability: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles all other cards revealed this way into his or her library.
card.flavor: "Ahh Opposable digits"
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If there are no creatures in the player's library, then the target creature is still destroyed, you see all the cards in that player's library, and then they shuffle and continue play.
10/1/2009 : If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Polymorph would resolve, the entire spell is countered. Nothing else happens.
10/1/2009 : If the targeted creature is indestructible, it's still a legal target -- it just isn't destroyed. The rest of Polymorph's effect happens as normal.
10/1/2009 : If there are no creature cards in the player's library, all the cards in that library are revealed, then the library is shuffled. (The targeted creature remains destroyed.)
10/1/2009 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Power Sink
card.ability: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If he or she doesn't, that player taps all lands with mana abilities he or she controls and empties his or her mana pool.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Does not increase the mana cost of the spell. It just requires a separate expenditure in order for it to succeed.
10/4/2004 : When this spell resolves, you either pay X mana or let your lands become tapped. The lands that become tapped are not "tapped for mana". If you choose to pay, you may pay the X mana using whatever mana abilities you want to use.
3/1/2010 : Only lands that actually have mana abilities will get tappped. This includes basic lands and lands with mana abilities printed on them, as well as lands which have been granted a mana ability by some effect.

card.name: Pradesh Gypsies
card.ability: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"A mysterious people indeed. Their origins are as secret as their traditions."
—Lord Magnus of Llanowar

card.name: Primal Clay
card.ability: As Primal Clay enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 artifact creature, a 2/2 artifact creature with flying, or a 1/6 Wall artifact creature with defender in addition to its other types. (A creature with defender can't attack.)
card.ruling:
7/1/2012 : In zones other than the battlefield, Primal Clay is 0/0.
7/1/2012 : If another permanent enters the battlefield as a copy of Primal Clay, the controller of that permanent will get to make a new choice. The copy won't necessarily have the same power, toughness, and abilities as the original.
7/1/2012 : If a creature that's already on the battlefield becomes a copy of Primal Clay, it copies the power, toughness, and abilities that were chosen for Primal Clay when it entered the battlefield.

card.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
card.ability: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Occasionally members of the Institute of Arcane Study acquire a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

card.name: Prosperity
card.ability: Each player draws X cards.
card.flavor:
"Wealth is a good thing, compared to poverty—your food is better, your robes are softer, and your companions have bathed more recently."
—Kukemssa pirate
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If both players run out of cards during this effect, the game is a draw.

card.name: Psychic Transfer
card.ability: If the difference between your life total and target player's life total is 5 or less, exchange life totals with that player.
card.flavor:
"The memory of your existence will fade like the final stars of morning."
—Kaervek
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : If one of the players has a negative life total, you use their actual life total for determining the difference. If that difference is five or less, then the other player receives the negative life total.
1/1/2011 : If an effect says that a player can't lose life, that player can't exchange life totals with a player who has a lower life total; in that case, the exchange won't happen.

card.name: Psychic Venom
card.ability:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Whenever the land is tapped for any reason, the ability triggers.

card.name: Pyrotechnics
card.ability: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
card.flavor:
"Hiniya Behold the man of flint, that's me / Four lightnings zigzag from me, strike and return."
—Navajo war chant
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can assign damage to multiple targets and are not forced to assign the same amount of damage to each target.
10/4/2004 : You can't do fractional points of damage.
10/1/2008 : The number of targets must be at least 1 and at most 4. You divide the damage as you cast Pyrokinesis, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

card.name: Python
card.flavor:
"How can you claim the gods are merciless when they robbed the snake of its limbs to give the other creatures a sporting chance?"
—Hakim, Loreweaver

card.name: Radjan Spirit
card.ability: {T}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can be used on a creature without Flying with no effect.

card.name: Rag Man
card.ability: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Target opponent reveals his or her hand and discards a creature card at random. Activate this ability only during your turn.
card.flavor: "Aw, he's just a silly, dirty little man. What's to be afraid of?"

card.name: Raging Goblin
card.ability: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
card.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.

card.name: Raise Dead
card.ability: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
10/4/2004 : The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.
4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Rampant Growth
card.ability: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Rath forces plants from its surface as one presses whey from cheese.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Razortooth Rats
card.ability: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.flavor:
"Men and rats both hunger: we for our playthings; they, for us."
—Crovax

card.name: Recall
card.ability: Discard X cards, then return a card from your graveyard to your hand for each card discarded this way. Exile Recall.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : You don't discard cards until Recall resolves. If you don't have X cards in your hand at that time, you discard all the cards in your hand.
10/1/2009 : You don't choose which cards in your graveyard you'll return to your hand until after you discard cards. You choose a card in your graveyard for each card you discarded, then you put all cards chosen this way into your hand at the same time. You may choose to return some or all of the cards you just discarded.

card.name: Reckless Embermage
card.ability: {1}{R}: Reckless Embermage deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to itself.
card.flavor: Many mages have been consumed by their work.

card.name: Redwood Treefolk
card.flavor: The soldiers chopped and chopped, and still the great tree stood, frowning down at them.

card.name: Regal Unicorn
card.flavor: Unicorns don't care if you believe in them any more than you care if they believe in you.

card.name: Regeneration
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

card.name: Relearn
card.ability: Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor:
"Barrin taught me that the hardest lessons to grasp are the ones you've already learned."
—Ertai, wizard adept

card.name: Relentless Assault
card.ability: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
card.flavor:
"Flog and Squee / Up the tree / See the army / Flee, flee, flee."
—Goblin nursery rhyme/war cry
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
10/4/2004 : Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
10/4/2004 : A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
10/4/2004 : It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

card.name: Remedy
card.ability: Prevent the next 5 damage that would be dealt this turn to any number of target creatures and/or players, divided as you choose.
card.flavor:
"These things will protect you while I'm gone, remind you of my love for you."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You choose the targets and you choose how to divide up the 5 damage on announcement.
10/4/2004 : You can't choose zero targets. You must choose at least one target.

card.name: Remove Soul
card.ability: Counter target creature spell.
card.flavor: Nethya stiffened suddenly, head cocked as if straining to hear some distant sound, then fell lifeless to the ground.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

card.name: Reprisal
card.ability: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"The meek shall fight as one, and they shall overcome even the greatest of foes."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

card.name: Resistance Fighter
card.ability: Sacrifice Resistance Fighter: Prevent all combat damage target creature would deal this turn.
card.flavor:
"My soldiers fought without hesitation, died without doubt."
—Sidar Jabari

card.name: Reverse Damage
card.ability: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It only affects damage dealt by the source one time. If the source damages you a second time this turn, the damage will not be reversed.

card.name: River Boa
card.ability:
Islandwalk
{G}: Regenerate River Boa.
card.flavor:
"But no one heard the snake's gentle hiss for peace over the elephant's trumpeting of war."
—Afari, Tales

card.name: Rod of Ruin
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Rowen
card.ability: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a basic land card this way, draw a card.
card.flavor:
"I've dreamt of a second harvest but fear I will not see it."
—Asmira, holy avenger
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The first sentence is a continuous ability. You reveal the card when you draw it, during the resolution of any draw effect. The second sentence is a triggered ability, and thus will wait until the entire draw effect finishes resolving before you do it.

card.name: Ruins of Trokair
card.ability:
Ruins of Trokair enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Ruins of Trokair: Add {W}{W} to your mana pool.

card.name: Sabretooth Tiger
card.ability: First strike
card.flavor:
"I fear anything with teeth measured in handspans"
—Norin the Wary

card.name: Sage Owl
card.ability:
Flying
When Sage Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
card.flavor: The owl asks but never answers.

card.name: Samite Healer
card.ability: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
card.flavor: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.

card.name: Scaled Wurm
card.flavor:
"Flourishing during the Ice Age, these wurms were the bane of all Kjeldorans. Their great size and ferocity made them the subject of countless nightmares—they embodied the worst of the Ice Age."
—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization

card.name: Scathe Zombies
card.flavor:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,
Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;
It had been strange, even in a dream,
To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Coleridge,
"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

card.name: Sea Monster
card.ability: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
card.flavor: Water is life. Or perhaps it is just something to wash it down with.

card.name: Segovian Leviathan
card.ability: Islandwalk
card.flavor:
"Leviathan, too Can you catch him with a fish-hook or run a line round his tongue?"
—The Bible, Job 41:1

card.name: Sengir Autocrat
card.ability:
When Sengir Autocrat enters the battlefield, put three 0/1 black Serf creature tokens onto the battlefield.
When Sengir Autocrat leaves the battlefield, exile all Serf tokens.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : When it leaves the battlefield, it exiles all Serf tokens on the battlefield and not just the ones it generated or just the ones under your control.

card.name: Serenity
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy all artifacts and enchantments. They can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"Just think of me as the storm before the calm."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : Serenity’s triggered ability destroys itself too.

card.name: Serra's Blessing
card.ability: Creatures you control have vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause them to tap.)
card.flavor:
"I have seen your strength imbued in angels' wings, and I have felt your sorrow rain down on the ruins brought by the Lord of the Wastes."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

card.name: Shanodin Dryads
card.ability: Forestwalk
card.flavor: Moving without sound, swift figures pass through branches and undergrowth completely unhindered. One with the trees around them, the dryads of Shanodin Forest are seen only when they wish to be.

card.name: Shatter
card.ability: Destroy target artifact.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Regenerating artifacts can regenerate from this.

card.name: Shatterstorm
card.ability: Destroy all artifacts. They can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: Chains of leaping fire and sizzling lightning laid waste the artificers' handiwork, sparing not a single device.

card.name: Shock
card.ability: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
Lightning tethers souls to the world.
—Kor saying

card.name: Sibilant Spirit
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Sibilant Spirit attacks, defending player may draw a card.
card.flavor: She had expected death to roar, to thunder, to growl. She did not recognize it when it came hissing to her side.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Your opponent does not have to draw a card if they don't want to.

card.name: Skull Catapult
card.ability: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Skull Catapult deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"What manner of fiend would design such a sadistic device?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

card.name: Sky Diamond
card.ability:
Sky Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
