{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

card.name: Snake Basket
card.ability: {X}, Sacrifice Snake Basket: Put X 1/1 green Snake creature tokens onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
card.flavor:
"Uh, does anyone have a flute?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool
card.ruling: 2/1/2006 : It used to make Cobra tokens. Now it makes Snake tokens.

card.name: Soldevi Sage
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice two lands: Draw three cards, then discard one of them.
card.flavor:
"To hide the truth is more than folly—it is fatal."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

card.name: Soul Net
card.ability: Whenever a creature dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If animated so it is a creature, it can be triggered off its own destruction.

card.name: Spell Blast
card.ability: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X.
card.flavor: Call it the thinking mage's version of brute force.

card.name: Spirit Link
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Damage that is redirected is not dealt to the original creature or player, but it is dealt to the new creature or player.
10/4/2004 : You only gain the life when the triggered ability resolves. If you are reduced to zero life before the ability resolves, you will lose before gaining the life.
4/1/2008 : You gain life for all damage which is not prevented, regardless of what the creature damages (player or another creature) or the toughness of the blocking creature. If you put this on a 5/5 and it is blocked by a 1/1, you still gain 5 life.

card.name: Spitting Drake
card.ability:
Flying
{R}: Spitting Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor: It prefers its meals cooked.

card.name: Spitting Earth
card.ability: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
card.flavor:
"There are times solid ground gives precious little comfort."
—Talibah, embermage

card.name: Stalking Tiger
card.ability: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature.
card.flavor: In the Jamuraan jungles, there is often no separating beauty from danger.

card.name: Standing Troops
card.ability: Vigilance
card.flavor: The less you have, the harder you fight for it.

card.name: Staunch Defenders
card.ability: When Staunch Defenders enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
card.flavor:
"Hold your position Leave doubt for the dying"
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

card.name: Stone Rain
card.ability: Destroy target land.

card.name: Storm Cauldron
card.ability:
Each player may play an additional land during each of his or her turns.
Whenever a land is tapped for mana, return it to its owner's hand.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If a land is tapped for mana and sacrificed all in one action, it goes to the graveyard before the Cauldron can return it to the player's hand.
10/4/2004 : If a land is tapped for mana, it is returned to its owner's hand as a triggered ability.
10/4/2004 : Having multiples of these on the battlefield means you can play an additional land for each one.

card.name: Storm Crow
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor:
Storm crow descending, winter unending.
Storm crow departing, summer is starting.

card.name: Strands of Night
card.ability: {B}{B}, Pay 2 life, Sacrifice a Swamp: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"I have seen the night torn into thin darkling strips and woven into shapes too bleak for dreams."
—Crovax

card.name: Stream of Life
card.ability: Target player gains X life.

card.name: Stromgald Cabal
card.ability: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target white spell.
card.flavor: When the alliance between Balduvia and Kjeldor deprived Stromgald of easy victories, its agents were forced to fuel their rituals with their own flesh.

card.name: Stupor
card.ability: Target opponent discards a card at random, then discards a card.
card.flavor:
There are medicines for all afflictions but idleness.
—Suq'Ata saying

card.name: Sulfurous Springs
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool. Sulfurous Springs deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Summer Bloom
card.ability: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.
card.flavor: Summer sends its kiss with warmth and blooming life.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This spell increases the number of lands you can play in a turn. The land cards are played as you would normally play lands.

card.name: Sunweb
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
Sunweb can't block creatures with power 2 or less.
card.flavor:
"There is no sweeter music than the wails of a dying dragon."
—Rashida Scalebane

card.name: Svyelunite Temple
card.ability:
Svyelunite Temple enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Svyelunite Temple: Add {U}{U} to your mana pool.

card.name: Syphon Soul
card.ability: Syphon Soul deals 2 damage to each other player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

card.name: Talruum Minotaur
card.ability: Haste
card.flavor:
Don't insult a Talruum unless your mount is swift.
—Suq'Ata saying

card.name: Tariff
card.ability: Each player sacrifices the creature he or she controls with the highest converted mana cost unless he or she pays that creature's mana cost. If two or more creatures a player controls are tied for highest cost, that player chooses one.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The choice of creatures is made on resolution and not on announcement.
10/4/2004 : You can use mana abilities during the resolution of this spell if the player decides to pay the mana cost.
10/4/2004 : You choose whether to pay or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice the creature. You can choose to not pay if you control no creatures on resolution.
4/1/2008 : First the active player identifies the creature he or she controls with the highest mana cost (and chooses one if there’s a tie) and chooses whether to sacrifice it or pay mana. Then each other player in turn order does the same. All creatures sacrificed this way are sacrificed at the same time.
4/1/2008 : Although Tariff checks the converted mana cost of the creatures on the battlefield, you need to pay the creature’s actual mana cost (including color) to keep it on the battlefield.

card.name: Teferi's Puzzle Box
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in his or her hand on the bottom of his or her library in any order, then draws that many cards.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You do your normal draw before this ability is put on the stack.
10/4/2004 : If you have more than one of these, each effect triggers separately.

card.name: Terror
card.ability: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

card.name: The Hive
card.ability: {5}, {T}: Put a 1/1 colorless Insect artifact creature token with flying named Wasp onto the battlefield. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: Mouths and wings beyond numbering, but a single mind to guide them.

card.name: Thicket Basilisk
card.ability: Whenever Thicket Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
card.flavor: Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the basilisk's terrible power.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Protection from Green does not stop the Basilisk's ability because the ability is not targeted.
10/4/2004 : The ability destroys the creature at the end of the combat, which is after all first strike and normal damage dealing is done. This means that a creature may have to regenerate twice to survive the combat, once from damage and once again at end of combat.

card.name: Throne of Bone
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

card.name: Tidal Surge
card.ability: Tap up to three target creatures without flying.
card.flavor:
"It is nature that gives us our boundaries and nature that enforces them."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

card.name: Trained Armodon
card.flavor: These are its last days. Better to grow broad and heavy. Better that the enemy is crushed beneath its carcass.

card.name: Tranquil Grove
card.ability: {1}{G}{G}: Destroy all other enchantments.

card.name: Tranquility
card.ability: Destroy all enchantments.

card.name: Tremor
card.ability: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
card.flavor:
"Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?"
—Naimag, Femeref philosopher

card.name: Tundra Wolves
card.ability: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
card.flavor: I heard their eerie howling, the wolves calling their kindred across the frozen plains.

card.name: Uktabi Orangutan
card.ability: When Uktabi Orangutan enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
card.flavor:
"Is it true that the apes wear furs of gold when they marry?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

card.name: Uktabi Wildcats
card.ability:
Uktabi Wildcats's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control.
{G}, Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate Uktabi Wildcats.

card.name: Underground River
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool. Underground River deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Unseen Walker
card.ability:
Forestwalk
{1}{G}{G}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"To pass through the jungle: silence, courtesy, ferocity, as the occasion demands."
—Kamau, "Proper Passage"

card.name: Unsummon
card.ability: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

card.name: Untamed Wilds
card.ability: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
10/15/2006 : Can fetch a Snow land.

card.name: Unyaro Griffin
card.ability:
Flying
Sacrifice Unyaro Griffin: Counter target red instant or sorcery spell.
card.flavor: The griffin's shadow gives courage to the righteous and dread to the idle.

card.name: Vampiric Tutor
card.ability: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
card.flavor:
"I write upon clean white parchment with a sharp quill and the blood of my students, divining their secrets."
—Shauku, Endbringer

card.name: Venerable Monk
card.ability: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
card.flavor: His presence brings not only a strong arm but also renewed hope.

card.name: Verduran Enchantress
card.ability: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
card.flavor: Some say magic was first practiced by women, who have always felt strong ties to the land.
card.ruling: 8/1/2005 : This does not trigger on the moving of an Aura from one permanent to another.

card.name: Vertigo
card.ability: Vertigo deals 2 damage to target creature with flying. That creature loses flying until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"I saw the wizard gesturing, but I didn't guess his plan until my aesthir cried out and went into a dive."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

card.name: Viashino Warrior
card.flavor:
"When traveling the Great Desert avoid wearing the scales of lizards, for the Viashino rule the sands and look poorly on the skinning of their cousins."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

card.name: Vitalize
card.ability: Untap all creatures you control.
card.flavor:
"After waking to the magic of Llanowar, no dreams can compare."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

card.name: Vodalian Soldiers
card.flavor:
"Vodalian rank is displayed by the colors and patterns of their skin. Beware the color red; that is the badge of the empress's favor."
—Corbio, pearl diver

card.name: Volcanic Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
card.flavor: Speed and fire are always a deadly combination.

card.name: Volcanic Geyser
card.ability: Volcanic Geyser deals X damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
My thunder comes before the lightning; my lightning comes before the clouds; my rain dries all the land it touches. What am I?
—Femeref riddle

card.name: Waiting in the Weeds
card.ability: Each player puts a 1/1 green Cat creature token onto the battlefield for each untapped Forest he or she controls.
card.flavor: The trees have ears, eyes, and teeth.

card.name: Wall of Air
card.ability: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor:
When no falcons fly, beware the sky.
—Femeref aphorism

card.name: Wall of Fire
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Struggle, and you will only fan the flames."
—Talibah, embermage

card.name: Wall of Swords
card.ability: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: Sharper than wind, lighter than air.

card.name: Wand of Denial
card.ability: {T}: Look at the top card of target player's library. If it's a nonland card, you may pay 2 life. If you do, put it into that player's graveyard.
card.flavor: You'll never miss what you never had.

card.name: Warmth
card.ability: Whenever an opponent casts a red spell, you gain 2 life.
card.flavor:
"Flame grows gentle with but a little distance."
—Orim, Samite healer
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It triggers on all opposing players.

card.name: Warrior's Honor
card.ability: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.ruling: 7/15/2007 : Warrior's Honor affects creatures you control that are on the battlefield at the time it resolves. If you put a creature onto the battlefield later in the turn, that creature won't get the bonus.

card.name: Warthog
card.ability: Swampwalk
card.flavor:
"Too much work—it takes a long time to break them in, and more than a few recruits."
—Grebog, goblin swine-rider

card.name: Wild Growth
card.ability:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The additional mana is not an ability of the land and is not something the land can produce.

card.name: Wind Drake
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor:
"No bird soars too high, if he soars with his own wings."
—William Blake,
The Marriage of Heaven and Hell

card.name: Wind Spirit
card.ability:
Flying
Wind Spirit can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
card.flavor:
" . . . When the trees bow down their heads,
The wind is passing by."
—Christina Rossetti,
"Who Has Seen the Wind?"

card.name: Wooden Sphere
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

card.name: Worldly Tutor
card.ability: Search your library for a creature card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
card.flavor:
"Aselbo soon had the rhino eating from his palm and the snake waiting at his heels."
—Afari, Tales
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Wrath of God
card.ability: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

card.name: Wyluli Wolf
card.ability: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"When one wolf calls, others follow. Who wants to fight creatures that eat scorpions?"
—Maimun al-Wyluli, diary

card.name: Zombie Master
card.ability:
Other Zombie creatures have swampwalk.
Other Zombies have "{B}: Regenerate this permanent."
card.flavor: He controlled the zombies even before his own death; now nothing can make them betray him.

card.name: Zur's Weirding
card.ability:
Players play with their hands revealed.
If a player would draw a card, he or she reveals it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player draws a card.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If someone pays the cost, then the card was never drawn or discarded. It just gets put into the graveyard directly from the library.
10/4/2004 : This is continuous replacement effect that modifies a draw.
10/4/2004 : If a spell or ability causes more than one card to be drawn, draw the cards one at a time and deal with this replacement before drawing the next card.
4/1/2006 : When using Dredge with this, you have two choices.  You can immediately replace the draw with Dredge, or you can apply Zur's Weirding's replacement.  If the latter, you first resolve Zur's Weirding's ability, then if you're going to draw the card, decide whether or not to replace that draw with Dredge.
